results.title: Kip and David. Episode 09
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David visit ‘Lamington National Park’ set high in the mountains. They see the rain forest with its giant trees, creepers, mosses and lichens, waterfalls and pools. They float leaf-boats down the small waterfalls, find a satin bower-bird’s playground and inspect the strange assortment of blue objects in it. Finally, they feed the wild scrub turkeys, bower birds, wild parrots and other small birds. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 12.
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Kip and David”.
Spring has arrived to David’s garden and Kip is feeling homesick for his island. David promises to take Kip back next time they return for a holiday. They set off to explore an old quarry, where they meet a geology student searching for fossils in the shale deposits. They find excellent fossils of plants and ripple patterns. David tries to use a geologist’s hammer and find a fossil to take home. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 04
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Kip and David”.
David and his elfin friend Kip discover many surprises while playing in the garden. A green tree frog hidden in a plant, a shady Traveller’s palm and newly grown mushrooms - ideal stools for Kip. As they search for a dry, sheltered home for Kip, they see bearded dragon and frilled lizards. After clearing a site at the foot of a tree, they draw a plan and prepare to build it. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 05
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Kip and David”.
David and his elfin friend work together on Kip’s tree house, using a framework of branches, thatching it with banana leaves and leaving spaces for a doorway and window. Finally, they build a rock garden, and place ‘Kip’s House’ above the entrance. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A thirteen part children’s adventure series made by Arthur and Corinne Cantrill about a young boy called David who meets a bushland elf while holidaying on Queensland’s Stradbroke Island and embarks on a series of adventures that highlight Australia’s wildlife and natural surroundings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 10.
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is a rainy day and Kip and David play indoors. They decide to try potato printing and create some curtains. After the rain, they put the curtains up in Kip’s house. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

group_works.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
group_works.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: Planning metrication
results.creator_credit: Stanley Marks, Stephen Cross and New Decade Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Keys to Metrication”.
The success of metrication depends on careful planning to keep companies in step with their suppliers and customers, and to keep company departments in step with one another. How to start and organise the changeover, aspects of phasing, control and costs, staff familiarisation and training; the importance of timing and of using the opportunity for rationalisation which metrication offers to large and small concerns.
